meanings.definition: A small prism used in photography to aid in focusing.
meanings.sent1: The photographer adjusted the microprism to sharpen the image.
meanings.sent2: The microprism helped the photographer focus the camera on the subject.
meanings.sent3: When the microprism started glowing, the photographer knew it was time to capture the perfect shot.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a microprism, reflecting every detail of the scene before her.
meanings.sent5: The tiny microprism made the picture crystal clear, like looking through a window.

meanings.definition: A tiny, geometrically shaped crystal used in microscopy.
meanings.sent1: Under the microscope, the microprism revealed intricate details of the specimen.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use a microprism to magnify small objects for closer examination.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous scientist accidentally dropped the microprism into the petri dish, creating a sparkly mess.
meanings.sent4: The microprism acted like a magnifying glass, bringing the tiniest features into focus.
meanings.sent5: Through the microprism, the world of the unseen became visible and fascinating.

meanings.definition: A small, transparent prism used in optical instruments.
meanings.sent1: The telescope's microprism enhanced the clarity of distant stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: Opticians often use a microprism to improve the precision of their instruments.
meanings.sent3: As the light passed through the microprism, it created a beautiful rainbow effect.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes viewed the world through a microprism, seeing beauty in every angle.
meanings.sent5: The microprism in the binoculars made the landscape appear closer and more vibrant.
